name: MoveMirror
short_description:
Compares two directories, moving files within the mirror directory so that its directory tree matches the master directory.

If there are new files or later versions in the master directory, MoveMirror copies these to the mirror directory. MoveMirror never makes changes to the master directory.

When you make changes to the master directory tree, run MoveMirror to make the same changes to the mirror directory. Unlike other sync programs, it moves files rather than deleting and recopying.

MoveMirror never deletes any files, nor does it overwrite any files. Old versions of files, or files that should no longer be in the mirror are not lost, they are simply moved to a "diff" directory for you to delete later. This makes the program safe to use.

MoveMirror is a Linux command line program. The first alpha version will be released soon.
summary: Sync two directories by moving files in the mirror to match the master
